intro: Uncinia jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican hookweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Uncinia jamaicensis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
